name: A LINKAN/AGONY Quiz | Words in Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Using only letters in "LINKAN", find a 4-letter word for a connecting part in a chain.
questions.explanation:
Link.

	A link is something that connects something else.  For instance, a chain link connects two pieces of chain.

questions.text: Using only letters in "LINKAN" and "AGONY", find a 5-letter word meaning to repeat, as in "let's go on the ride ___".
questions.explanation:
Again.

	If you repeat something, or do it a second time, you do it "again".  For instance, if you rode the carousel already, but want to ride it another time, you would say that you want to ride it again.

questions.text: Using only letters in "LINKAN" and "AGONY", find a 3-letter word for a piece of wood that you might burn in a fireplace.
questions.explanation:
Log & Oak.

	Logs are parts of a tree that are used in a fireplace or a campfire.  Dry logs work better than wet logs in making a fire.  A common expression, which has nothing to do with logs, but instead, snoring, is "sawing logs".

questions.text: Using only letters in "LINKAN" and "AGONY", find a 4-letter word meaning to tug or pull.
questions.explanation:
yank.

	To yank something means to give it a sharp tug or pull.  Yank can also be a shortened form of Yankee, which means an American.

questions.text: Using only letters in "LINKAN" and "AGONY", find a 4-letter word for a point you make in soccer or hockey, or something you achieve.
questions.explanation:
Goal.

	A goal is something you achieve, or something you try to accomplish.  It can also be when you get a point in soccer or hockey.

questions.text: Using only letters in "LINKAN" and "AGONY", find a 5-letter word meaning to bother or pester.
questions.explanation:
Annoy.

	If you bother someone, you pester or annoy them.  If they are bothered, they are annoyed.  And, finally, if you are botherING someone, you are "annoying" them, which is an even longer word that can be spelled using only letters in "LINKAN" and "AGONY"!

questions.text: Using only letters in "LINKAN" and "AGONY", find a 4-letter word for an animal that is called the "king of the jungle".
questions.explanation:
Lion.

	A lion is often called the "king of the jungle", but it doesn't live in the jungle!  It actually lived in the savannas of Africa.  It is a large cat, and it eats meat.  Female lions are called lionesses.

questions.text: Using only letters in "LINKAN" and "AGONY", find a 4-letter word for a ruler, the queen's husband.
questions.explanation:
King.

	A king is a ruler of a kingdom.  His wife is known as the queen, his sons are princes, and his daughters are princesses.  There have been many kings in history, like King Henry VIII of England.

questions.text: Using only letters in "LINKAN" and "AGONY", find a 5-letter word for someone who takes care of children.
questions.explanation:
Nanny.

	A nanny is someone who takes care of children when the parents are unable to.  They are sort of like babysitters.  Mary Poppins is a very famous nanny.

questions.text: Using only letters in "LINKAN" and "AGONY", find a 4-letter word meaning greasy.
questions.explanation:
Oily.

	If something is oily, it is greasy and slimy.  Sometimes something oily is also kind of sticky.  If you touch something that is oily, your fingers are often turned black!
